did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: George Ray Chamberlain glass plate negatives, [ca.1890-1910]
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Glass negatives of campus scenes and buildings and Ithaca and other local scenes, including Wahuta, the family cottage on Cayuga Lake.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: George Ray Chamberlain graduated from Cornell in 1891, with a degree in mechanical (electrical) engineering. From 1892 to 1896, he attended the Art Students' League in New York, and worked as an illustrator and cartoonist, including work with Liberty Hyde Bailey. In 1902, he became an instructor in Industrial Drawing and Art in Sibley College of Mechanical Engineering and, after 1906, an instructor and professor of free-hand drawing in the College of Architecture at Cornell. In 1903, he married Grace Caldwell, the daughter of chemistry professor George Caldwell.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Glass negatives of campus scenes and buildings and Ithaca and other local scenes, including Wahuta, the family cottage on Cayuga Lake.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: George Ray Chamberlain. Glass Plate Negatives, #47-1-3543. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
